Contributor: Judson, E., artist.; United States Food Administration, publisher.; Carey Printing Company, printing.;
Note: Signed "E. Judson" (?) Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Horizontal
Description: Text says that the consumption of sugar sweetened drinks must be reduced, because the ships which would deliver the sugar for the drinks are needed to carry soldier's and supplies. Illustration shows a women drinking with a straw as a bunch of tiny ships marked "sugar"  go in her direction while other little ships marked "supplies" and "soldiers" go in the direction of the "war."
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Subject: Food conservation -- United States.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; War posters, American.;

Title: Sugar means ships
